message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has occasional morning dizziness and palpitations, and the ECG shows an irregular pulse, which suggests she may have atrial fibrillation. However, the patient feels well and there are no other concerning findings. Reassurance is the most appropriate first step, as further testing or medication may not be necessary at this time. Event recorder implantation, stress echocardiography, and administration of flecainide may be considered later if needed.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The ECG shows ventricular premature contractions with compensatory pauses, but no ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation. As the patient is young and has occasional, mild symptoms, reassurance is the most appropriate next step. Event recorder implantation or stress echocardiography can be considered if symptoms worsen or become more frequent. Administration of flecainide is not necessary at this time.
